title: Swoole not supported HTTP Client SSL SNI? (ssl handshake failure)
author: emdfreeman

comments.body: How to enable ssl_tls_sni in swoole?

Thank you!

P.S. I checked but with an error ('ssl_host_name' => 'https: /intoconsultoria.com',)

satisfaction_conditions: Demonstrate configuration of SNI support in Swoole's HTTP client
Show proper hostname specification for SSL/TLS negotiation
Resolve SSL handshake failures caused by missing SNI extension
Explain SSL-related client configuration options in Swoole

_classification.category: Can be dockerized without any issue

dockerfile:
FROM php:7.4-cli

# Install system dependencies required for building Swoole
RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y \
    git \
    build-essential \
    autoconf \
    automake \
    libtool \
    libpcre3-dev \
    libssl-dev \
    && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

# Clone swoole-src repository and checkout the specific commit with the fix
RUN git clone https://github.com/swoole/swoole-src.git /usr/src/swoole-src \
    && cd /usr/src/swoole-src \
    && git checkout 7c8747fd202d81286171973fdde8c70e19711173

# Build and install Swoole extension with default configuration
RUN cd /usr/src/swoole-src \
    && phpize \
    && ./configure \
    && make -j$(nproc) \
    && make install \
    && docker-php-ext-enable swoole

# Ensure OpenSSL support is enabled (automatic when libssl-dev is installed)
# The test script can be copied and executed manually in container:
# COPY test_script.php /root/
# CMD ["php", "/root/test_script.php"]
